alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 3:48PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. John The Baptist, St. James, northwestern St. Charles, north central Terrebonne, northwestern Lafourche and southeastern Assumption Parishes through 415 PM CST... At 348 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Labadieville, or 11 miles southwest of Thibodaux, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thibodaux, Reserve, Hahnville, Gramercy, Lutcher, Killona, Schriever, Gray, Edgard, South Vacherie, Convent, North Vacherie, Garyville, Wallace, Chackbay, Labadieville, Taft, Supreme, Montz and Raceland. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 190 and 201. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
